attributes.action: Update food allergies laws to list allergens on menus in food establishments
attributes.background: In 2014, food allergies laws were passed for food establishments to tell customers if their food contains ingredients known to trigger allergies. It has recently become apparent staff don't always provide the correct information. An update is needed to make it compulsory for the info to be on menus

attributes.action: Nationalise UK mobile telephone masts.
attributes.background: 6 December 2018, O2 experienced a widespread failure affecting 20m+ UK customers. However other network providers continued to enjoy access. This petition would bring into public hands the network of phone masts, thus guaranteeing equality of access for customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Mobile data access is a key part of working and personal life for almost all people in the UK today. 

To have access for some and not for others when a network goes down is depriving large segments of the population with the ability to be productive, happy, and even safe.

It does not need to be this way, if the hardware of UK mobile data coverage was recognised as a natural monopoly and brought into public hands so it could also be managed in the public interest, all would be better off.

attributes.action: Change student loan arrangements to reflect career success
attributes.background:
The current arrangements reduce the incentive for students to achieve high-earning roles. Successful students see their debt increase every year until they are earning 4 x the average salary. 
Lower earners may never repay anything. This situation cannot be justified.
attributes.additional_details: The interest on the debt should be fixed at the no more than half a percent above the Bank of England rate when the loan is issued. Repayment should then be taken from all earnings/income (with no lower limit) at a rate that would pay the interest charges and reduce the outstanding balance. If students never work then the loan should be collected by a small reduction in any benefits.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of possible depo provera injection side effects
attributes.background: Depo provera injection for birth control and to stop periods I chose this was right treatment for myself only to of met my partner and us decide we want to try for a baby well as we looked deeply on the internet to see what side effects I would well what we found out was really bad and shocking.
attributes.additional_details: The mood swings, irregular periods, and potentially getting bone loss density which some women have through this the reading just shocked me if I had done more research 4+ years ago I would of never of had it. I think this injection should come with a warning label or taken off the market our nurses and doctors just don't know enough and should be well trained in this.

attributes.action: Force rail companies to freeze rail fares for at least 5 years.
attributes.background: The new rise in rail fares is criminal and only lining the pockets of the wealthy running the trains in Britain. We demand that the rail fares be frozen so that people are not being stripped of their cash and being made poorer just to get to work.

attributes.action: Require unused hospital and pharmacy prescriptions to be reused, not thrown out
attributes.background: My client was a pharmacist in a UK hospital. All prescriptions that were not collected from patients are put in the bin if not collected and not reused. this is a complete waste of money. They are not opened and not used we need to stop this.

attributes.action: Reform GDPR/Data Law with Automatic Fines on Bodies/Organisations not Complying
attributes.background: Since the GDPR was updated in May 2018 some public bodies/organisations still do not comply. Reform GDPR/Data Law to impose Automatic Daily Fines for failure to respond/comply with a data request within 1 month. If any records are withhold an automatic fine of the ICO maximum of Â£500,000 must apply
attributes.additional_details: If public bodies/organisations wish to recover some of the costs of the fines they will have to appeal to court to prove which information is being withheld/concealed from individuals & why, how the information was gathered & generated or records contaminated. If proven there is an attempt to obstruct justice those involved should be ordered to pay towards the fine/costs. We must have accountability across our public services, every individual in the UK is entitled to access to all their records

attributes.action: legally require a receipt to be printed only if a customer actually wants one
attributes.background: Many large companies automatically print receipts for customers after small transactions (namely fast food shops and brands offering a self service experience). Customers often do not take these receipts. This is an incredible waste of paper that is not justifiable and can be easily avoided.

attributes.action: SELECTIVE licensing for tenants should be removed or applied for all landlords.
attributes.background:
SELECTIVE licensing for certain areas and certain landlords is unfair.

The law should be same for all where ever you live in the country.

This should also be applied to letting agencies and housing estates.
attributes.additional_details:
Lisence is applied when you commence a business and require authority of the council this should be same for everyone not selective.

Also the law should be applied to council areas not privately owned.

Safety of tenants can also be address in many other ways.

We are all equal in England and the law should be passed for all not few.

attributes.action: Require differential off-peak electricity rates.
attributes.background: The energy companies have eroded the differential between the night time and day time electricity tariffs, originally introduced to provide competition to other providers of energy, such as oil and gas.
attributes.additional_details: The recent hikes in off-peak rates for electricity have made heating homes for users of storage heaters, in particular, very difficult. Many people, often pensioners, invested in this form of central heating years ago and would find a change to oil (or gas if available) central heating prohibitive.

attributes.action: UK to sign the United Nations Convention on Migrantsâ Rights
attributes.background:
The International Convention on the Protection of the Rights
of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families is a United Nations multilateral treaty governing the protection of migrant workers and families. It has still not been signed by the UK despite being adopted by General Assembly 1990.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ohchr.org/en/professionalinterest/pages/cmw.aspx

attributes.action: More Money For Unemployed
attributes.background: Unemployed People Like Myself Struggle To Put Food On The Table. Afford Gas And Electric And Rent Top Ups. We Should Get Additional Support From DWP

attributes.action: Inspect and license all breeders of horses and ponies to prevent suffering
attributes.background: The government must introduce and enforce inspection and licensing of breeders to prevent cruel exploitative breeding of poor quality horses and ponies. The licensing fee will pay for the enforcement. Please lobby your MP and Michael Gove Minister for DEFRA responsible for horse welfare.

attributes.action: Make cat calling an illegal act in the UK
attributes.background:
Cat calling refers to the act of shouting harassing and often sexually suggestive, threatening, or derisive comments at someone publicly. 

Surveys have found that 85% of people under 40 years old have taken a different route home to avoid harassment. Cat Calling should not have this power.
attributes.additional_details:
End Violence Against Women Coalition commissioned YouGov to conduct the first national poll on street harassment in 2016. The poll found that 64% of women of all ages have experienced unwanted sexual harassment in public places.

There are laws in the UK which focus on sexual misconduct but none specifically related to catcalling. This is not an impossible task with countries like Portugal, Belgium and France having already implemented such laws.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of buying beer and alco-pops 5% and under, wine under 13% to 16
attributes.background: We would like the legal age of purchasing certain alcoholic beverages to the age of 16. By reducing the purchasing of beer and wine to 16 there will be less consumption of hard spirits as well as the use of counterfeit identification. This will promote a safer way for children to experiment.
attributes.additional_details: This theory is modelled on many European countries laws; Belgium, Germany and Spain. In 2016, 7,327 people died from alcohol related deaths of which many were caused by excessive drinking of spirits. The countries current legislation promotes the use of spirits for underage teenagers to become intoxicated. So by legalising a safer alternative to consume alcohol, which is an inevitability, there will be a decrease in alcohol related medical conditions in underage teenagers.

attributes.action: Consider funding a northern bypass for Ipswich.
attributes.background: The Orwell bridge. A14. Major artery from the expanding port of felixstowe. When the bridge gets closed in either direction due to bad weather, usually high winds, or a road traffic incident. All traffic is diverted through Ipswich town which causes absolute mayhem.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-44656588

One particular day the wind brought down trees and blocked local roads which were already congested due to tge bridge closure. This particular day it took me 90 minutes to get to work, 7 miles away...! There was an idea of allowing cars only in high winds but surely that would pose health and safefy issues.

attributes.action: Change 30 hours free child care eligible 51 weeks a year instead of term time
attributes.background: Current funding of 30 free hours only covers term time which for most working parents only actually covers maybe a day and a half child care as like me most work full time meaning if you have more then 1 child costs soon add up.  get the government to change 30hours free a week not just in term

attributes.action: Pass the Restroom Access Act 2005 (Ally's Law) in the UK
attributes.background: The Restroom Access Act 2005 is an act in the USA that requires establishments that have toilet facilities for their employees to also allow customers to use the facilities if the customer suffers from an inflammatory bowel disease or other medical conditon requiring immediate access to a toilet.
attributes.additional_details: There is not enough awareness of IBD in the UK, hopefully signing this petition will help bring out this awareness and pass the Act.

attributes.action: Income Tax changes to be more diverse either individual or per house hold
attributes.background: Currently income tax works on an individual basis, therefore if a household has two workers at 35k they both pay 20% tax each, however in a family with children only one adult works they are penalised after 46k,
attributes.additional_details:
Council tax and other taxes work on the basis of per house hold so why not for Income Tax, changing this to a per household rate allowing partners to absorb/ utilise the tax allowance prior to the increase to 40% and/or 50%. 

Example could be: Adult 1 salary 20k, Adult 2 salary 60k tax would only increase to 40% once 80k mark has hit, this would aide families where only one parent is working and/ or coupled adults living under a single roof

attributes.action: Ban body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers
attributes.background: I have seen so many celebrity body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers. Teenagers are reading it. It can affect their state of mental health especially, including using 'photoshop' photos, 'perfect' bodies. This is the only way it'll stop.
attributes.additional_details: Most recent is Stacey Solomon was on front of Now Magazine with headline 'boring' 'desperate' 'cheap' and why fans are sick of her because they saw a couple comments about her continuous positivity on body confidence, and next there was another story about revenge bodies, and it's wrong to do this, and there should be a ban on body-shaming, bullying in magazines, and should focusing on celebrating your body, and be confident in your skin, and what you look like.

attributes.action: Bring in minimum standards for certain camping equipment sold in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a huge amount of camping equipment abandoned at festivals every year which is bad for the environment. Much of the equipment is of a poor standard and inadequate for the British summer leading to many people getting cold and wet to the extent that they need medical help.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum standards should be -
Tents must have an inner and outer skin and a minimum Hydrostatic Head rating of 3000. (Small play tents can be exempt.)
Any sleeping bag rated as suitable only for temperatures over 5 degrees centigrade should be clearly labelled "UK Indoors Only".
Roll mats must have a minimum thickness when compressed. 
All folding chairs and stools must have their maximum weight clearly displayed in kilogrammes and stones and pounds, in large letters on the sales label.

attributes.action: Require councils to provide lollypop men and women
attributes.background: Stop any councils in England from using the funds for road crossing supervisors (Lollypop men and Women) to save money. The UK Government should provide additional funding for councils if necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please check out https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/school-crossing-patrol-staffordshire-cuts-1997550 and ITV central news 13/9/18

attributes.action: Add Middle Rate Mobility for children receiving Disability Living Allowance
attributes.background:
My 10 year daughter has hyper mobility type Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, she has low muscle tone, subluxations of joints, swelling of joints, widespread joint pain to name a few symptoms. 
She has ankle braces, insoles, a wheelchair and other aids to help but she has never been entitled to mobility.
attributes.additional_details:
There is 3 rates of care but only 2 for mobility and the criterias for 2 rates donât accomadate for children like my daughter. 
For LRM the criteria is the child needs âguidance or supervision with walking on unfamiliar routesâ and for HRM the criteria is the child must be unable to walk, virtually unable to walk, have no legs or feet, be SMI, be SVI, be blind and deaf or be a danger to them self. There should be an in between for children who have days where they need a wheelchair etc.

attributes.action: Require schools to sell logos to sew on to uniforms
attributes.background: Uniform costs are rising and parents are having to worry about meeting these costs. If schools were made to sell their logos to sew onto cheaper alternatives this would alleviate a massive burden. Instead of paying Â£50 for a blazer cheaper ones are available at a fraction of the cost etc.

attributes.action: Create a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children
attributes.background: Introduce a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children. I propose a small tax on all goods sold in England. The tax money will buy food for starving African children. Food security is very important, because when people have no money or food, eventually wars happen.
attributes.additional_details: Overall, 5.6 million children under age five died in 2016, nearly 15,000 daily. The risk of a child dying before five years of age is highest in Africa - about 8 times higher than in Europe. Eventually if other countries from around the world put a tax on their goods too, this international tax money would help collapsed economies from around the world, so it would be like a world social security ensuring the world to be a safer world to live in for everyone.

attributes.action: Ban any advertising for cars which aren't zero emissions.
attributes.background: We should treat cars and the pollution they create as a public health issue, as was done with smoking and the ban on cigarette advertising.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum gambling age to 21
attributes.background: Investing in the youth begins with removing unfavourable distractions from their environment. There is no logic in students leaving education to in contrast be exposed to negative influences such as; alcohol, becoming addicted to drugs or equally gambling!
attributes.additional_details:
A recent study shows that approximately 96% of gamblers are doing so in their home (Gambling Commission, 2019) which means that, it becomes easier for everyone regardless of age group to have access to gambling tools. 

Having worked for one of the top bookmakers for over several years I have seen firsthand some of the damage gambling is doing to people of all ages

attributes.action: Reduce Drink Drive Limit to zero
attributes.background:
Hundreds of people are killed every year as a result of drink driving. 

Why do we allow people to drink and drive???

Stop all drink driving and stop unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details:
Department Of Transport
Last updated 14 February 2019.

Final estimates of casualties in accidents due to drink-drive limit for 2016.

Between 220 and 250 people were killed in drink drive accidents, with a estimate of 230 fatalities since 2015. Continuing a period of stability recorded since 2010 an estimated 9,040 people were killed or injured in drink-drive accidents, a rise of 7% since 2015 the total number of drink-drive accidents rose by 6% to 6,070 in 2016.

attributes.action: Every life Matters too - Mandatory Custodial Sentences for assaults of any kind
attributes.background:
"Every journey matters to the Mayor of London and TFL" - Well, How about a more important slogan of "Every life Matters too" and resolve the lawlessness in this country too!
 
We need tougher Policing and tougher Sentencing for all assaults of any kind, whether on the streets or inside prisons.
attributes.additional_details:
ALL proven assaults of any kind, on civilians and civil servants alike, should be met with an automatic custodial sentence and all such sentences should be served consecutively, not concurrently, to any other sentences, if any.
 
Sentencing should after all be a real deterrent against assault and abuse, not just a mere distraction.
 
Every life matters.

attributes.action: Set maximum levels of council tax increases per year legislation across the UK
attributes.background: Local authorities are increasing their levels of council tax at unprecedented rates. These rates are dramatically higher than inflation levels and rather than look to make their local authority more efficient the only solution seems to be to increase the cost of living.

attributes.action: 30 hours free child care to all full time working parents from the age of 1.
attributes.background: All full time working parents should be allowed to send their children to nursery from the age of 1. This would help and encourage woman to go back to their full time work. It will reduce benefits amounts  given from councils and help full time working parents.
attributes.additional_details:
A lot of woman can not go back to work as they fear for their children care, and simply a lot of people struggle financially as they can not afford full time nursery. 
I strongly believe that full time working parents should get priority to send their children to nursery for free from the age of 1. It will encourage people and reduce the amount of benefits taken.

attributes.action: Make investigating noise nuisances a police responsibility
attributes.background: At this time there is nobody who can Witness what is going on, people on the receiving end have to go through weeks of keeping a Diary while Suffering with Lack of Sleep.
attributes.additional_details:
The Police should have some control, investigate the issues and stop it.
 
Needs Common Sense put into dealing with it.
 
How can our Legal system allow Drums to be played and the Bass and Music turned up at 2am in the morning.
 
Others we have spoken to say they just turn theirs up higher and higher which does not solve anything.
 
People are supposed to have Hours of Quietness, this goes out the window in these cases.

attributes.action: UK parliament must condemn terrorist attack on Indian forces by JeM & supporters
attributes.background: 14-Feb-19 convoy with Indian security personnel attacked by suicide bomber in Pulwama, 44 dead. Responsibility claimed by Pakistan-based militant group Jaish-e-Mohd. This was a non-combat situation - so this a blatant terrorist attack. UK Parliament must condemn the perpetuators & its supporters.
attributes.additional_details: The UK as a world leader needs to go beyond the generic government press releases and FCO Twitter messages about this ghastly attack and have our Parliament to wholeheartedly condemn the perpetuators of this attack & its supporters and to express solidarity with India who are also a leading Commonwealth nation.

attributes.action: Increase direct government funding to improve the support for homeless people.
attributes.background: This is a very important issue.
attributes.additional_details: Primary and secondary data.

attributes.action: Make government consultants more transparent
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement that any organization wishing to enter into consultancy with Government undergo full Parliamentary scrutiny by select committee and a full declaration of all their funding sources.
attributes.additional_details:
It has become increasingly apparent that organisations with sources of dark money have penetrated British politics without any scrutiny or accountability. 
In order to fully retake control of Parliamentâs Sovereignty, any future influence from independent consultancies should be subject to the most thorough of screening processes. 
In order to rebuild our broken democracy there must be a move towards openness and transparency.

attributes.action: Legally required rescue insurance cover for adventure sports/outdoor pursuits
attributes.background: Rescue authorities are subjected to very expensive rescue operations which in many cases could have been avoided and are currently financed by the taxpayer. Rescuers are also risking their own safety. Thrill Seekers should meet the costs in the event of their rescue and have to take out insurance.

attributes.action: Give employees the right to sue employers for health and safety breaches
attributes.background: We must return to the earlier system to ensure that employees have the right to sue their employer for health and safety breaches or injuries.
attributes.additional_details: Section 47 of the HASAWA 1974 restrict employee from taking civil proceedings against employer for failure to comply with the health and safety law. This is against the spirit of the health and safety legislation and natural justice. It is also not compatible with access to justice under Human Rights Act 1998.

attributes.action: ABOLISH VAT ON ALL FOOD AND DRINK
attributes.background:
Did you know that in this day and age with food banks in existence the government still collect VAT on basic foods like:

Potato crisps
Biscuits
Ice cream
Chocolate bars
Mineral water
Fizzy drinks
Alcohol free beer and wine
Fruit squash
attributes.additional_details:
This isnât a time to get all judgemental on whether these food and drinks are unhealthy or not.  People are starving because they canât afford to eat!

Knocking VAT off the selling price mean that the cost of basic food and drink items could be:

6p for a pack of crisps
1p for a biscuit
10p for a choc ice
2p for 250ml of fizzy drink

Make these high calorie per pence foods more available to reduce malnutrition.  Make your food shopping budget go further.

attributes.action: Legislate a Less Lethal Firearms license for civilians
attributes.background:
A Less Lethal Firearms license should be legislated for civilians to purchase, possess, open carry and use PAVA Spray and/or a Taser.

This should be accompanied by a Firearms Act 2020 amendment with Section 5 exemptions for civilians with a license.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of increasing violent crime and strain on the Police Service, civilians with jobs such as Security Guards, Doormen, Delivery Guards and Neighbourhood Patrol groups should have a lawful right to a low risk form of OCW (Open Carry Weapon) for use in defence, escape and citizens arrests with lower casualty risks when confronted with physical violence.

Security checks and training in correct and lawful use should be mandatory before purchase and ownership of a Taser or PAVA Spray.

attributes.action: You should only be able to take a maximum of five driving tests.
attributes.background: You should only be able to attempt a maximum of five driving tests as to take more than five would be a fluke pass, this would reduce the number of vehicle's on the road easing congestion and would also be a massive improvement for the environment cutting pollution massively.

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd referendum (2 tier), stay or leave, if leave: Mays deal or No Deal.
attributes.background: The government is incapable of making a decision, and seems frozen over Brexit. The PM seems to deliberately waste the remaining time to force through her deal, and no-one is opposing Brexit, for fear of being labeled the one who undermined the referendum. They seemingly vote against all the options
attributes.additional_details:
The government are losing credibility, force them to enact a 2 tier referendum, stay or leave, if leave, May's deal or No deal.
Then make it clear that no matter how damaging, the outcome will be followed. No matter what, it cannot put us in a worse position than we are in currently.

attributes.action: Introduce 'on road' Cycling to Driving lessons/Driving Test
attributes.background: Driving Test/Lessons to include 3 Hours (30 minute segments) of on road cycling for those able to do so
attributes.additional_details: Give humans the perspective to see the road from both a driving a car and riding a bicycle

attributes.action: Increase Maternity Leave up to 2 years .
attributes.background: Let stay mums with babies longer. Its a so painful to leave 6 month old baby already with a family member or childminder when he or she needs mums warm and cuddles most.

attributes.action: Stop the 4 year back date of repayments for families over child benefit limits
attributes.background:
Petition question: 
"is it morally and ethically right for the government to allow HMRC to demand repayments dating 4 / 5 years previous, from families who received child benefit incorrectly when the rules around the thresholds were only made clear to these families from September 2018".
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of families including mine have just received demands of thousands of pounds from HMRC asking for all benefits paid for the past 4 or 5 years. My salary has always been below the relevant child benefit threshold but with private medical, bonus and company car, this all takes me above all thresholds. How was I to know, HMRC did not clearly advertise this. It feels like it is only when the government need to find more funds for something like the NHS do they decide to tell people so they can claim the millions back.

attributes.action: Physician associate students should be able to apply for full student finance
attributes.background: PA students  should be able to apply for full student finance such as Tuition fees maintenance loan and childcare, this is an intense course and students can not take part time jobs and most Nhs professionals joined this course had to leave work and there currently shortage in the nhs

attributes.action: GCSE Maths, English and Science should be optional from year 10
attributes.background: Many GCSE students will find the knowledge either difficult or pointless as there is so much to remember on top of the pressure from other subjects. Also other students may get bored and distract those who do want to take the subject in future potentially causing them to achieve lower.

attributes.action: Eliminate the effects of the use of single-use plastic in takeaway restaurants.
attributes.background: We are a group of sixth form students who are highly concerned with the use of single-use plastics. This is because it uses fossil fuels, is non- biodegradable and pollutes our oceans resulting in the killing of animals and disruption of food chains.
attributes.additional_details: We are increasingly worried about the future of our planet, with plastic contributing to a huge carbon footprint. We want to eliminate the use of unnecessary plastic in takeaways nationally.

attributes.action: All large Companies should have a Mental Health First Aider in the work place..
attributes.background: Make it mandatory for all large companies that employ more than 10 people to have a mental health first aider in the work place. This would help raise awareness and prevent discrimination to employees who suffer a mental health problem.

attributes.action: Make English Literature an optional subject for GCSE
attributes.background: Many students feel that learning quotations for novels that are outdated and not relevant to today's society is unnecessary and a waste of time, therefore making it an optional subject and replacing it with a lesson dedicated to life skills would prove to be much more useful for the students
attributes.additional_details: English Language should remain as a compulsory subject in the GCSE subject selection while English Literature should be optional as it is not a useful skill in later life. Furthermore, the amount that students are required to learn can be overwhelming for them and also requires significantly more effort relative to other subjects.

attributes.action: Review the UK Parliament-Government petition site.
attributes.background: I believe that the Parliament-Government petition site is a farce and the people's voice is not listened to. Petitions unpopular with government do not get the proper attention and are hamstrung from the start.
attributes.additional_details: Rejected petitions get a copy and paste response. The first chance to reject petitions is done with a copy and paste response "It is unclear what you want the Government or Parliament to do." In the unlikely event that it gets past this point, a government response is given at the first milestone and a farcical "debate" confirms the "government line." This has to change.
